lead_paragraph: TANANBAUM--Stanley. The Trustees and staff of The Metropolitan Museum of Art mourn the passing of Stanley Tananbaum. He and his late wife Doris were Benefactors of the Museum since 1997 and steadfast supporters of the American Wing for over five decades, where they participated as Friends of the American Wing, as William Cullen Bryant Fellows, and as significant contributors to the development of the Museum's activities and galleries for American art. In recognition of their gifts, The Doris and Stanley Tananbaum Galleries for American decorative arts were named in their honor. We are grateful to Stanley and Doris for their generosity, which will continue to benefit the millions of visitors to the American Wing in the years ahead. Daniel Brodsky, Chairman Thomas P. Campbell, Director and CEO Daniel H. Weiss, President 1/3
